com.hazelcast.jet.pipeline

Class ContextFactories

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.jet.pipeline.ContextFactories

  • public final class ContextFactories
extends Object
    Utility class with methods that create several useful context factories.

    • Method Detail

      • replicatedMapContext

        @Nonnull
public static <K,V> ContextFactory<ReplicatedMap<K,V>> replicatedMapContext(@Nonnull
                                                                                     String mapName)
        Returns a factory that provides a ReplicatedMap as the context object. A replicated map is a particularly good choice if you are enriching an event stream with the data stored in the Hazelcast Jet cluster. Unlike in a hashJoin transformation, the data in the map can change while the job is running so you can keep the enriching dataset up-to-date. Unlike IMap, the data you access is local so you won't do any blocking calls using it (important for performance).

        If you want to destroy the map after the job finishes, call factory.destroyFn(ReplicatedMap::destroy) on the object you get from this method.

        Example usage (without destroyFn): 

         p.drawFrom( /* a batch or streaming source */ )
  .mapUsingContext(replicatedMapContext("fooMapName"),
      (map, item) -> tuple2(item, map.get(item.getKey())))
  .destroyFn(ReplicatedMap::destroy);
        Type Parameters:
        K - type of the map key
        V - type of the map value
        Parameters:
        mapName - name of the ReplicatedMap to use as the context

      • iMapContext

        @Nonnull
public static <K,V> ContextFactory<IMapJet<K,V>> iMapContext(@Nonnull
                                                                      String mapName)
        Returns a factory that provides an IMapJet as the context. This is useful if you are enriching an event stream with the data stored in the Hazelcast Jet cluster. Unlike in a hashJoin transformation, the data in the map can change while the job is running so you can keep the enriching dataset up-to-date.

        Instead of using this factory, you can call GeneralStage.mapUsingIMap(IMap, FunctionEx, BiFunctionEx) or GeneralStageWithKey.mapUsingIMap(IMap, BiFunctionEx).

        If you plan to use a sync method on the map, call ContextFactory.toNonCooperative() on the returned factory.

        Type Parameters:
        K - key type
        V - value type
        Parameters:
        mapName - name of the map used as context
        Returns:
        the context factory
